abstract: An N.R.A. official said the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney, one of the nine people killed in Charleston, S.C., could have prevented the attack if he had not supported a ban on guns in churches.

headline.main: N.R.A. Board Member Deletes Criticism of Victim in Church Massacre

snippet: An N.R.A. official said the Rev. Clementa C. Pinckney, one of the nine people killed in Charleston, S.C., could have prevented the attack if he had not supported a ban on guns in churches.
